content:
### EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Furnace cluster at positions (0.0, 0.0), (2.0, 0.0), and (2.0, 2.0)
Consists of the following entities:
- Furnace (position (0.0, 0.0)) with fuel: coal (13), status: NO_INGREDIENTS
- Furnace (position (2.0, 0.0)) with fuel: coal (6), status: NO_INGREDIENTS, producing iron plates (18)
- Furnace (position (2.0, 2.0)) with fuel: coal (20), status: NO_INGREDIENTS, producing iron plates (20)

### Wooden chest at position (5.5, 0.5)
Consists of the following entities:
- Wooden chest (position (5.5, 0.5)) with inventory containing iron plates (160)

### Lab at position (10.5, 10.5)
Consists of the following entities:
- Lab (position (10.5, 10.5)) with status: NO_POWER

### Electricity generator at position (6.5, 0.5)
Consists of:
- Small electric pole (position (6.5, 0.5)) connected to the lab at position (10.5, 10.5)

### Electricity network
Consists of:
- Small electric pole (position (12.5, 13.5)) connected to the lab at position (10.5, 10.5)
- Small electric pole (position (11.5, 13.5)) connected to the lab at position (10.5, 10.5)
- Small electric pole (position (10.5, 13.5)) connected to the lab at position (10.5, 10.5)

### ERROR TIPS

### Errors when connecting entities without required items
- Ensure you have the necessary items in your inventory before attempting to connect entities. In this case, small electric poles were required to connect the lab to the power source.

### Errors when using extracting but being too far
- Make sure to move to the target entity where you want to extract from before extracting items.

### Errors when placing into a tile which is occupied by another entity
- Ensure you can place an entity to a tile before attempting placing.

### Errors with incorrect entity types
- Ensure that when using functions that require an entity or entity group, you are passing the correct type and not a position. This was encountered when inserting items into furnaces.

### Errors when placing electric poles
- Ensure there is a clear space for placing electric poles. If there is an existing object in the way, the placement will fail.

### Errors with missing inventory items
- Always check your inventory before attempting to place or connect entities. If you run out of items, you will not be able to perform the action.
